Expectation1: Look out for each other's safety and well-being
Situation1: One sibling is about to cross the street without looking for oncoming traffic.
Expectation2: Fix bugs and troubleshoot issues reported by users or QA
Situation2: Several users report intermittent errors that disrupt normal usage
Story: My phone buzzed with a flurry of notifications just as I stepped outside with my younger brother. The QA team had flagged a critical bug—users were getting kicked out of the app at random, and the product manager’s messages were piling up, each more urgent than the last. I scrolled through the error logs, mind racing with possible causes, barely noticing my brother skipping ahead. He was humming, lost in his own world, and before I realized, he was at the curb, about to step into the street. My heart lurched. I knew I should drop everything and grab him, make sure he looked both ways. But my mind was still tangled in code, replaying stack traces and user complaints. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in—my brother’s safety in one hand, the company’s trust in the other. I stood frozen, torn between shouting his name and diving back into the bug that couldn’t wait.
